description: John Singleton Copley garnered considerable success as a portrait painter before the Revolutionary War. The sitter here, Mary Greene Hubbard, was a member of Boston’s merchant class. Her pose, gown, and background were precisely copied from a British engraving of a noblewoman, yet Copley distinguished the work as his own by capturing Hubbard’s unique features and the luxurious fabrics she wears.
title: Mrs. Daniel Hubbard (Mary Greene)
